title: Getting sick of percentage based damage
body:
REGURGITATE DAMAGE: 20 / 24 / 28 / 32 / 36% (+ 4% per 100 AP) target's max. health

im sorry but thats unacceptable.

[(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=07So_lJQyqw)]

replies.body:
It wont end up being that high when he gets launched to live.

And besides even at that high percent much of it will be reduced by armour or magic resist depending on what type of damage the ability does. Since it scales with AP probably will do magic damage.

Since most people will likely play him as a support, it will be unlikely that you'll need to worry about him, as building support items tends to ruin a champion's ability to survive or do damage.
Such damage will come to be a problem only when he is played as a solo laner or jungler, and for him to be able to maximise the percentage damage there he will need to buy penetration items, but as he wants to build tanky it's unlikely that he will be getting those items.

im pretty sure percent max health damage is true damage so it wont get reduced. either way its still the only damage he does at all. also "Max Regurgitate Damage: 300 / 350 / 400 / 450 / 500" that might just be for monsters though. id be more afraid of the actual crowd control component. in a teamfight if you get swallowed and the enemy team is right on top of you you're dead for more than 30% of your health

I doubt it would be true damage. Vayne's true damage is stupidly overpowered as it is an it's only 8% and needs a serious nerf.

36% of your health + 4% for every 100AP is absolutely ridiculous as true damage.

His Q also does damage, and he can eat and spit out a minion with his W for damage. Also don't forget his ult's passive that increases his damage output by a % of his own maximum health. Meaning his AAs will do damage as well.

It's very unlikely that W when used to consume an enemy champion will do true damage, and it's very likely the numbers will be toned down a fair bit while he spends the next two to three weeks on the PBE.

if you cant beat em play them :P the other guys right all new champs have to be strong, who'd wanna buy a weak champ at all? combine a new champ with being potentially op theres a much higher chance of being bought

Except as I've already said to the others.

New champs being OP to make players buy them is completely bullshit. 
>Why do Riot only "balance" the popular champs, because there is enough data on them to do so.
It's like how people say Riot intentionally make new champs overpowered on release so people buy them for FreELO.
1) Champs are free, you'll find yourself at a point where you have 100,000 IP and nothing but new champions to spend it on.
2) The PBE is too small to actually offer any real amount of usable data in terms of balancing a champion, only when a champion is on the Live client and popular will Riot know where the issues lie and be able to work on them. Ryze is a good current example of this, and you can hear that talked about in the latest Patch Rundown https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=feCeOcI8GZ0

The whole idea that Riot is so thirsty for cash that they make champs overpowered deliberately on launch is retarded. Not even EA is that thirst for money.

no the "idea" is perfectly plausible, therefore riot and EA would want to, and be able to, take advantage of that, as is expected. if riot arent thirsty for cash why do they constantly not aim to fix so....fucking....many...problems to do with league, and instead release shitty fucking chroma packs and an even more amount of skins?

What problems hmm?
Bug splats?
Sorry to tell you, but the majority of bug splats you come across are more than likely your own fault and you should update your computer systems and hardware.
Every single "problem" I see on the forums is either being looked at and treated (eg toxic behavior) or to do with one's own potato powered shoe they ordered from the local junk dealer.
All those crashes and bug splats people talk about, strange they never happen to me.
I guess building my own PC, and keeping it well maintained doesn't count for anything then.

As for the money side of things, yeah Riot are now making Chroma Packs, strange they they only just started doing that this year, I mean it's obviously a great money making scheme right? Spend hardly any effort recolouring and then just throw it at them for money.

Huh now that I look at it, isn't the only way Riot can make money by selling skins and now Chromas?
After all they are the only thing in the game that can ONLY be bought with RP.
Champions can be bought with IP, and as I've said the majority of players end up at a point where they can't use their IP on anything other than champions because you end up with a stockpile of 100,000 or more. Hell one weak of playing the game and you make enough IP to buy the next three champions to come out.

It's definitely a money making scheme to make new champions overpowered on launch as to scam real world money out of players. Oh wait!
The two posts below give examples of champs that were trash and underpowered on launch, hell if you actually paid attention the majority of champs on launch are weak, with maybe one overpowered ability.
There goes that money making scam.

Q: B-b-but Klavinmour, what about all the times I got completely destroyed by this new champ on release? D:

A: Simple, you had no idea how the champion works, nor how your champion works again theirs. You got thrashed because you're inexperienced in dealing with the champion in question. The champion is neither overpowered or underpowered.

This is me adding information here. 

{{champion:432}} and {{champion:161}} were not OP
at all. Everyone said Bard was completely shit and very situational and Vel'Koz was just too immobile to be OP despite the strong or supposed OP damage is brought.

And then we also have {{champion:268}} who nobody could play on release (and most still can't) yet he was considered trash tier despite having overclocked numbers.
Then {{champion:236}} was ridiculously overpowered at one point last year and continues to be a pain, yet on release he was utterly shit.

I think the reason why people thought Lucian was shit was because they thought his ultimate should and would do a lot more damage. 
That was never the point of its design.
Just more examples to the same point really.
